rtweettree 0.0.0.9000

    • Visualize tweet tree

rtweettree

The goal of rtweettree is to scrape a twitter tweet and all replies, quotes and likes (recursively) and visualize them in a network graph.

Responsible use

{{rtweettree}} should be used in strict accordance with Twitter’s developer terms.

Installation

To get the current development version from Github:

## install remotes package if it's not already
if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}

## install dev version of rtweettree from github
# remotes::install_github("UrsWilke/rtweettree")

load rtweettree package

library(rtweettree)

Usage

In order to use {{rtweettree}} please refer to the according section of {{rtweet}}.

An example how to create a subtweet network graph is shown in the vignette for tree visualization

# vignette("visualize_tree", package = "rtweettree")
